name: places/ChIJ42UBn1tYwokRJLHdii0G_Lg
adrFormatAddress: 679 11th Ave, New York, NY 10019, USA

originalText.text:
This dealership is 4 stories up. Entrance is on the 49th st with free valet. Nicely decorated and clean. Lots of new displayed cars to browse around.

We were help by Raymond Liang. He was very helpful and very responsive. He was totally upfront with everything. No hidden fee, etc. Raymond explained how all the cars features worked patiently. He didn't try to hastle or hurried us with any decision.

We drove from Philadelphia and drove back satisfied with a certified used RX350.

originalText.text:
I recently purchased a brand new car through Lexus of Manhattan. I have to say my experience there was nothing short of exceptional.
I have been looking at cars for a few weeks and have visited 8 dealer locations in the NYC area. The people and service at Lexus was hands down the best experience.
The Lexus of Manhattan dealership is beautiful by the way. The people there are very welcoming. I didn't have that experience in many of the dealerships I went into.
My sales associate Raymond was so kind, patient and really listened to what I needed. I never felt pressured and was taken care of every step of the way.
I was completely open to any brand but Lexus checked the boxes when it came to model style, features, price, overall longevity and service.
I noticed that communication between the departments was very efficient. Sani, the manager, was always present. I was never left just waiting, trying to figure out what was happening.
Everything was done very quickly. When the car that I was interested in was in storage, they moved it to the dealer location by the very next day. My buying process took a few days because I had a few things to work out.
When Raymond was out for the day, Konstantinos took over and took care of us. He was so pleasant to work with. Nothing was stepped over; everything was explained from finalizing the buying process to explaining everything about the car to me before I left the lot. I had such a great experience working with Raymond and Konstantinos I would definitely buy another car from them in the future. If you're looking for a new car, definitely check out Lexus of Manhattan.

originalText.text: Such a horrible experience... We found the vehicle, called, and spoke to a sales agent.  Loved it, super nice and helpful, sent us photos and videos since we were out of state.  Super responsive. Wired the money the next day then after that it was a complete 180 from the sales agent.  Would not get back to us, and WE had to be the ones to initiate the contact... said we would receive our vehicle delivered a week or two after we sent the payment and it took about a MONTH to receive it.  Every time we called for an update he was short and rude.  Our vehicle was not detailed, we had to pay to get it detailed here in Michigan, it was missing the mat for the driver's seat.  It has been almost two months and we still don't have our license plate... It took them a week or longer (AFTER the vehicle was delivered) to say they were "missing" some type of document from us and that is why it's taking longer... We sent over the document that same day and a few days later we got a call from someone else in their "financial department" asking for the SAME document!!  I had to pay extra days on the rental car since the delivery was delayed, had to pay to get it detailed and now I'm afraid we are probably going to have to pay to do the plate and registration here (AGAIN) AND take time off work since they still do not have any real answers for us!! Love the car BUT this whole experience has been HORRIBLE- If you are out of state, I would not feel good about dealing with them!  Not sure if it was just our luck with this one agent or what but man, this has been a nightmare!!

Love the car BUT this whole experience has been HORRIBLE- If you are out of state, I would not feel good about dealing with them!  Not sure if it was just our luck with this one agent or what but man, this has been a nightmare!!

originalText.text:
I really did not want to write this review, since I have had a relationship with this dealership since 2018. All my past interactions with this dealership were amazing because of Danny leach. He is a very professional guy and honest. I got a offer on October 17th on a lexus premium.  In which, I decided to decline because I wanted a rx f sport or premium plus . I explained to Sherwin that the price was great but it was hard for me to give up my current f sport Rx. I never heard anything from the dealership about December to remember sale. I was tossed to a salesmen name dominique  Smith.  Every phone call started with him telling of Sherwin's promotion. I do not know what that had to do with me. I would not recommend dominique  Smith to sell a box of school supplies. He is sarcastic and has attitude for the most simplest questions. He says your giving very little down , but I asked him what if I give bigger down payment from money I will get later on. He tells me
it wouldn't make a difference and to save money.  Today was just the final straw of his attitude. I started talking to lexus of larchmont and it's night and day. This dealership was not like this in the past. This sucks because Danny leach is a good guy and never treated me like this . I really wanted to to continue my relationship with them.

originalText.text: Had a really great car buying experience at Lexus of Manhattan. I’ve always driven German brands in the past, but I was intrigued by the new Lexus Hybrid offerings. Never know what to expect when walking into a dealership as a new customer.   Warren and Sunny were a pleasure to deal with, and they really worked hard to make my deal happen. They are a great sales team and I’m loving my new Lexus RX350h.
